fields.name: Tobias
fields.description: He is a Rhipsalis, even though he is a cactus he doesn’t like much sunlight and likes a little more water. He seems easy-going so far.
fields.care: Water regularly, without overwatering. Light is important but not direct light.

fields.name: Hadassah
fields.description: She is a Monstera Adansoni, still deciding if she should climb or trail, tbh I’m just afraid to bother her to death.
fields.care: LIGHT - It prefers light indirect light. It can survive in lower light. WATER - enjoys to dry out to about 75% before it is watered again. Never allow your plant to sit in water or soggy soil, as this can lead to root rot and the eventual death of your plant. HUMIDITY - benefit from a boost in humidity. Misting, or placing a humidifier nearby.

fields.name: Christopher
fields.description: He is a Monstera Adansoni and he is very moody, I never know what he wants and neither does he. Needless to say, he is annoying but of course, I don’t say that to him (might propagate & grow him with water (FOREVER))
fields.care: LIGHT - It prefers light indirect light. It can survive in lower light. WATER - enjoys to dry out to about 75% before it is watered again. Never allow your plant to sit in water or soggy soil, as this can lead to root rot and the eventual death of your plant. HUMIDITY - benefit from a boost in humidity. Misting, or placing a humidifier nearby.

fields.name: Duncan
fields.description: He is a mix of Cacti, that’s about it, not much character in this one. I'd describes it as callous, but he still cute
fields.care: LIGHT - Prefers direct sunlight. WATER - water almost never. HUMIDITY - doesn't care for it.

fields.name: Jasmine
fields.description: I just gave birth to her. She is an English Ivy. Let’s see how well she does in this self-watering system
fields.care: LIGHT - It prefers indirect light. It can survive in lower light. WATER - regular weekly watering enjoys but allow to dry out before watering again. Never allow your plant to sit in water or soggy soil, as this can lead to root rot and the eventual death of your plant. HUMIDITY - keep moist over winters, it benefits from a boost in humidity. Misting, or placing a humidifier nearby.

fields.name: Fransiska
fields.description: She is an Asparagus Fern, I heard not the easiest but she makes me smile.
fields.care: LIGHT - It prefers light indirect light. It can survive in lower light. WATER - enjoys moist soil but wet. Never allow your plant to sit in water or soggy soil, as this can lead to root rot and the eventual death of your plant. HUMIDITY - benefit from a boost in humidity. Misting, or placing a humidifier nearby.

fields.name: Vera
fields.description: She is an Aloe Vera, I should probably move her closer to a window because of the sun. but she looks nice here. I water her like once a month. And also I use her juice in, my hair care regime.
fields.care: LIGHT - Prefers direct sunlight, next to a southern window. WATER - it deeply but infrequently, allow the soil to dry at least 1 to 2 inches deep between waterings. TEMP - does in best 13 and 27°C.

fields.name: Bongo
fields.description: I laugh every time I say his name also reminds me of “The Flinstones”. He is a spineless yucca, very low maintenance I can’t remember when last I watered him, he’ll be fine. His leaves are sharp too.
fields.care: LIGHT - Prefers bright, direct sunlight. WATER - it deeply but infrequently, allow the top soil to dry at least 1 to 2 inches deep between waterings. TEMP - indoor temp is good.

fields.name: Irene
fields.description: She is a “Dracaena marginata bicolour” when i look at her I feel at peace, hence the name. She likes regular misting and doesn’t care for direct light.
fields.care: LIGHT - It prefers light indirect light. It can survive in lower light. WATER - only water when top 1-2 inches of soil is dry, use room temp water. HUMIDITY&TEMP - mist sometimes.

fields.name: Stinky
fields.description: She had a very stinky smell when I got her but now she’s fine. She is a “Prayer Plant”/Maranta. She loves humidity and being moist “she thirsty”. A fun fact at night her leaves fold upwards hence “prayer”.
fields.care: LIGHT - It prefers light indirect light. It can survive in lower light. WATER - enjoys moist soil but not wet. HUMIDITY - benefit from a boost in humidity. Misting, or placing a humidifier nearby or keep in the toilet.

fields.name: Stickkan
fields.description: He is a Prickly Pear or a Bunny ears Cactus. I can’t tell the difference, I just know he is the reason for my splinters, which really hurts. I pretty much ignore him, he’s independent.
fields.care: LIGHT - Prefers direct sunlight. WATER - it deeply but infrequently, wait till completely dry. TEMP - does in best 13 and 27°C.

fields.name: Bella
fields.description: She is a BOP-Bird of paradise. She’s the fairest of them all. When I look at her I just wanna recite 1 of the song of Solomon love poems. She loves light and forest-like humidity, she’s very fertile too. #thebiasinmytone
fields.care: LIGHT - can handle light levels from direct sunlight to low indirect light. However, it will flourish in a sunny spot. WATER - keep the soil moist, but not soggy during the spring through fall. In the winter, allow two inches of soil to dry out between waterings. Never allow your plant to sit in water or soggy soil, as this can lead to root rot and the eventual death of your plant. HUMIDITY - appreciates the occasional misting, which also helps remove the dust from its glossy dark leaves.

fields.name: Lydia
fields.description: She’s a Fiddle Leaf Fig plant. She loves light, humidity and coffee. Yeah, coffee gives her the perfect pH less acidic witch it doesn’t like. I’m struggling to find her a pretty pot, so she’s been in her nursery pot
fields.care: LIGHT - prefer lots of bright, filtered light. WATER - wait for the top inch of your fiddle leaf fig tree’s soil to dry before you pick up your watering can. Lukewarm water works best since cold water can put plants into shock. HUMIDITY - benefit from a boost in humidity. Misting, or placing a humidifier nearby.

fields.name: Bonnie
fields.description: He is a Bonsai/Ficus microcarpa. He is easy going but gets very dramatic when not happy by dropping leaves frantically. He doesn’t like drafts either. He can be quite a looker!
fields.care: LIGHT - It prefers direct sunlight, next to a southern window. WATER - the most important rule is, never water on a routine, only water when needed. HUMIDITY - benefit from a boost in humidity. Misting, or placing a humidifier nearby.

fields.name: Aroleia
fields.description: She is a Devils Ivy or Gullranka. This one can be both a climber or a hanger and is a fast grower and its beauty pays of instantly.
fields.care: LIGHT - does well in low light. WATER - allow to dry out completely between waterings. HUMIDITY - enjoys average to high humidity

fields.name: Mattias
fields.description: Good 'ol fella, doesn't bother me much, I like his glass home, he looks happy.
fields.care: LIGHT - It prefers light indirect light. It can survive in lower light. WATER - enjoys to dry out to about 75% before it is watered again. Never allow your plant to sit in water or soggy soil, as this can lead to root rot and the eventual death of your plant. HUMIDITY - leaves enhoy misting

fields.name: Meghan
fields.description: She is a Monstera and ofcourse is royal. She is quite the center-piece, one cannot go without noticing her, neither do I, everyday!
fields.care: LIGHT - thrives in bright to medium indirect light.. WATER - every 1-2 weeks, allowing soil to dry in between. HUMIDITY - benefit from a boost in humidity. Misting, or placing a humidifier nearby.

fields.name: JackieChan
fields.description: He is a Devils Ivy or Gullranka. This one can be both a climber or a hanger and is a fast grower and its beauty pays of instantly.
fields.care: LIGHT - does well in low light. WATER - allow to dry out completely between waterings. HUMIDITY - enjoys average to high humidity

fields.name: Molly
fields.description: She is a Radermachera, quite the needy one too, she doesn't seem to grow much.
fields.care: LIGHT - Prefers direct sunlight. WATER - water every 4 days even during winter season. HUMIDITY - benefit from a boost in humidity. Misting, or placing a humidifier nearby.

fields.name: Xiomara
fields.description: She is a Devils Ivy or Gullranka. She is a very special baby too me, I keep her in my room.
fields.care: LIGHT - does well in low light. WATER - allow to dry out completely between waterings. HUMIDITY - enjoys average to high humidity

fields.name: Poppy
fields.description: She is a Cactus, we got history she and I. She fell off 2 meters high the first time I attempted to hang her in a terrarium, she survived, the next terrarium I man handled and slightly cracked the glass.
fields.care: LIGHT - Prefers direct sunlight. WATER - it deeply but infrequently, wait till completely dry. TEMP - does in best 13 and 27°C.

fields.name: Jeffrey
fields.description: He is a Snakeplant, also known as “mother in laws tongue” and is a great beginner plant. Great air cleaner too.
fields.care: LIGHT - prefers bright indirect. WATER - allow to dry out completely between waterings.

fields.name: Rut
fields.description: She is a Peace Lily and and can literally survive WW3 if there was, she is fighter
fields.care: LIGHT - It prefers bright indirect light. It can survive in lower light. WATER - consistency is key, keep the soil moist. HUMIDITY - benefit from a boost in humidity. Misting, or placing a humidifier nearby.

fields.name: Sandra
fields.description: She is a desert plant, forgot her species to be honest. She gorgeous though!
fields.care: LIGHT - Prefers direct sunlight. WATER - it deeply but infrequently, wait till completely dry. TEMP - does in best 13 and 27°C.

fields.name: Joachim
fields.description: He is a Golden Cane Palm or Areca Palm, he is my beloved, need I say more
fields.care: LIGHT - It prefers bright light. It can survive in lower light. WATER -  every 5 to 7 days depending on light and temperature. HUMIDITY - benefit from a boost in humidity. Misting, or placing a humidifier nearby.

fields.name: Fanny
fields.description: He is a Devils Ivy or gullranka. This one can be both a climber or a hanger and is a fast grower and its beauty pays of instantly.
fields.care: LIGHT - does well in low light. WATER - allow to dry out completely between waterings. HUMIDITY - enjoys average to high humidity

fields.name: Liyla
fields.description: She is a Sansevieria Bacularis, she is cute and fits well in her glass sandal.
fields.care: LIGHT - Prefers direct bright light can survive low. WATER - it deeply but infrequently, wait till completely dry. TEMP - does in best 13 and 27°C.

fields.name: Theresa
fields.description: She is a Sansevieria Bacularis, a hybrid snake plant.
fields.care: LIGHT - Prefers direct bright light can survive low. WATER - it deeply but infrequently, wait till completely dry. TEMP - does in best 13 and 27°C.

fields.name: Emma
fields.description: She is a Celosia, shes quite the drama queen needs water every other day or else she plates dead. Give her all the sun and few drinks and shes happy. #highmaintenace
fields.care: LIGHT - Prefers direct sunlight. WATER - water every other day even during winter season. HUMIDITY - benefit from a boost in humidity. Misting, or placing a humidifier nearby.
